name: kingfisher
description: MongoDB's blazingly fast secret scanning and validation tool

repo.name: kingfisher
repo.description: Kingfisher is a blazingly fast and highly accurate tool for secret detection and live validation across files, Git repos, GitHub, GitLab, Azure Repos, BitBucket, Gitea, AWS S3, Docker images, Jira, Slack, and Confluence

readme.summary: Exceptionally clear, well-structured README with excellent visual aids, comprehensive installation options, and strong quick-start examples, though troubleshooting content is limited.
readme.top_issue: Lacks dedicated troubleshooting section for common installation or runtime errors

security.summary: The code has some input validation issues and potential error exposure risks, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: Performance/startup overhead (3s startup time for file scanning)
External API dependency issues (Atlassian removing endpoints, timeouts)
Integration complexity (no Python bindings, CLI-only interface)
False positives in detection rules (SHA256 hashes flagged as credentials)
praise_themes: Active bug fixing (multiple bugs closed recently)
New features being implemented (findings viewer, access map demo)
Regular releases and updates (v1.69.0 to v1.73.0 in recent weeks)
sentiment.summary: Kingfisher shows healthy active maintenance with responsive issue closure, though users express frustration over performance constraints, external API fragility, and limited integration options for non-CLI workflows.

communication.summary: The maintainer responses are highly helpful, clear, patient, and technically sound, making them an exemplary model for open-source project maintainers.

concerns: No commits in the past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-14)
Zero active contributors in the past 6 months
No merged PRs in the past 6 months
No closed issues in the past 6 months indicating no maintenance activity
4 open issues with no resolution activity
Unknown last release date suggests no recent versioning
maintenance.summary: This package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity for at least 6 months despite having unresolved open issues.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-structured and comprehensive, but lacks explicit breaking change markers and migration guides.

project_metrics.description: Kingfisher is a blazingly fast and highly accurate tool for secret detection and live validation across files, Git repos, GitHub, GitLab, Azure Repos, BitBucket, Gitea, AWS S3, Docker images, Jira, Slack, and Confluence

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally clear and provides a good overview of the package's features, but installation instructions are incomplete and troubleshooting information is lacking.
concerns: Docs: Insufficient installation instructions for various platforms
High bus factor risk (98% from top contributor)
highlights: High number of commits in the past 6 months (964)
Recent last commit and release dates (2026-01-03)
Multiple merged PRs in the past 6 months (105)
